page.title: 01Central Weald of Kent
page.content: The area is principally used for agriculture. It is bordered on its Northern Boundary by the main London-Ashford main line railway. The block is a flat plain, lying at between 60-120' above sea level rising on its Southern border to 200'. The B2079 splits the block North-South,travelling through the principal residential area the village of Marden. Marden has a parish population of about 3000 principally involved in agriculture and local asociated industry. Main crops are fruit (apples and pears) and hops but in recent years more arable crops, corn, oil seed rape etc have been grown. The land is generally Grade II and III. The wooded areas to the south are used for game shooting (Pheasant). The yearly rainfall is around23".
